intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius canadense, commonly known as Canadian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
